title: When I click ‘Open in Unity’, my asset does not download.

sections.title: Symptoms
content:
• I have purchased an asset and received my PDF Unity invoice confirming my purchase.
  • When I click ‘Open in Unity’ to trigger the download, it does not work.

sections.title: Cause
content: This is usually a problem to do with connectivity, but rarely can also be due to a server error at our end.
Sometimes sites that will open perfectly within your browser are blocked from opening within Unity by proxies, firewalls, or anti-viral software.

sections.title: Resolution
content: Firstly, please try downloading the asset from within the Editor by following this process:

• Open Unity Engine.
  • Click "Window" > "Asset Store".
  • Log in
  • Find Asset.
  • Click the ‘buy’ button. If you have already purchased, there will be an option to download or import.
  • Download Asset.
If this does not work for you, it could be a connectivity issue. Please test your connectivity by following these suggestions:

• If you have a firewall, or proxy running go into the settings and allow these ports: 80 and 443
  • If you have an anti-viral software running, please temporarily disable it and see if that allows the asset to download
  • If you have a weak, or intermittent Internet connection, assets will not be downloaded. Please be aware of this when purchasing assets.
If none of the above are true for your machine/ network, please contact us here in case there is a problem with the asset, or with our servers.

sections.title: More Information
content:
Once assets have been downloaded, they can also be found in the following directory:
Windows - User>AppData>Roaming>Unity> Asset Store
Mac - User>Library>Unity>Asset Store
